text: 13. Thank you @AliceJBradbury @Dominic_Wyse thank you for this excellent piece of work.  Phonics has an important place- in a rich, balanced, vibrant, inspiring and creative tapestry of literacy. Right now there is no balance- our young readers and writers will pay the price.

text: 12. And yet their expertise and voices are ignored and disregarded. Some are told off for going off the script. They sing. They use games. They talk about words and language. This is against the rules. They are told to follow the script. Rigid schemes that ignore the child.

text: 10. Phonics isn't about understanding. It is not about a love or joy of reading. If you don't believe me check out the books children can access when they are only learning satpin. No content. No stories. Just sit, pit, pat, tap, tip...

text: Phonics is dominating young children's educational experience. It is 1 part of literacy. Literacy is one of 7 areas of learning and development. A specific area- that rests on the prime areas- inc communication. But during a phonics session there is little time to communicate.
